suncertify.utils
Class SmartComboBox

java.lang.Object
  suncertify.utils.SmartComboBox
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
FilenameComboBox
public class SmartComboBox
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

A decorator class for an editable combo box. This provides a popup menu of the list items that match the currently entered text, in order to reduce the amount of typing that the user has to do, and to avoid having to look through a large popup menu. The user can display the full item list by clicking the combo box button in the normal way, or by pressing Ctrl + down (or Meta + down). This class contains a workaround for Bug 5100422 - Hide Popup on focus loss. Thread safety: Not thread safe.

See Also:

SmartComboBox

public SmartComboBox(javax.swing.JComboBox combo)
Decorates the given combo box with a popup menu of items that match the currently entered text.

Parameters:
combo - the combo box to decorate
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the combo box's editor is not an instance of JTextComponent
Method Detail

setDocumentFilter

public final void setDocumentFilter(javax.swing.text.Document filter)
Set a document filter to only allow valid strings to be entered by the user. The filter's insertString method is used to determine if the input should be allowed.

Parameters:
filter - the new filter to use

isAutoCompleting

public final boolean isAutoCompleting()
Determine if item autocompleting is on or off. If item autocompleting is enabled, the editor text will autocomplete to the first matching item, and the appended text will be highlighted.

Returns:
true if editor will automatically insert the first item in the list that matches the current text

setAutoCompleting

public final void setAutoCompleting(boolean autoCompleting)
Set item autocompleting on or off. If item autocompleting is enabled, the editor text will autocomplete to the first matching item, and the appended text will be highlighted.

Parameters:
autoCompleting - true to autocomplete word with first match

isSelectionWrapping

public final boolean isSelectionWrapping()
Determine whether we wrap around when we exceed the start/end of the list of possible matches. If true, we will wrap back to the first item when we exceed the end, and wrap to the last item when we go before the first item.

Returns:
true if selection will wrap around

setSelectionWrapping

public final void setSelectionWrapping(boolean selectionWrapping)
Set whether to wrap around when we exceed the start/end of the list of possible matches. If true, we will wrap back to the first item when we exceed the end, and wrap to the last item when we go before the first item.

Parameters:
selectionWrapping - true to wrap around

true if matches are appended to the existing editor text

Convenience method to show the match list.

getOffsetForMatchList

protected int getOffsetForMatchList(java.lang.String editorText)
Get the horizontal position where the list of matches should appear, measured in characters. For example, returning editorText.length() would make the match list appear immediately after the editor text. Subclasses should override this to display the list in the correct position.

Parameters:
editorText - the current editor text
Returns:
the spacing from the left of the combo box to the left of the match list (measured in characters)

getMatchingItems

protected java.lang.Object[] getMatchingItems(java.lang.String stringToMatch)
Get a list of items that match the current text. By default we just check for items that begin with the string to match. A subclass might override this method to do something more complex, such as looking for items that contain the string to match.

Parameters:
stringToMatch - the string to find matches for
Returns:
list of combo box items that match stringToMatch
